services.name: Carbon Footprint Analyzer
services.overview: The Carbon Footprint Analyzer is an AI-powered SaaS platform designed to automatically calculate, analyze, and report a company's carbon footprint across its entire value chain. It addresses the challenge many organizations face in accurately measuring their emissions due to complex supply chains, disparate data sources, and data gaps. The platform utilizes machine learning to estimate emissions based on financial transactions, operational data, and industry benchmarks, filling in missing data points with predictive modeling. This enables organizations to gain a comprehensive understanding of their environmental impact, identify emission hotspots, and implement targeted reduction strategies. Furthermore, it streamlines ESG reporting and enhances stakeholder communication, positioning companies as leaders in sustainability. The platform is specifically tailored to meet the needs of sustainability managers, CFOs, and supply chain managers within climate tech startups and established enterprises alike.
problems_addressed: Inaccurate carbon emissions measurement due to complex supply chains and data gaps.
Difficulty in identifying emission hotspots across the value chain.
Time-consuming and resource-intensive manual carbon accounting processes.
Lack of comprehensive insights for targeted emission reduction strategies.
Challenges in meeting increasing ESG reporting requirements and stakeholder expectations.
target_users: Sustainability Managers: Responsible for developing and implementing sustainability strategies and reporting.
CFOs: Oversee financial reporting and resource allocation, including sustainability investments.
Supply Chain Managers: Manage and optimize supply chain operations, including reducing environmental impact.
Climate Tech Startup Executives: Need comprehensive carbon accounting to demonstrate impact and attract investment.
core_features: Automated Carbon Footprint Calculation: Automatically calculates Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions based on uploaded financial transactions, operational data, and supplier information. The system uses machine learning models trained on industry-specific emissions factors and benchmarks to fill in data gaps and provide accurate estimates.

Emission Hotspot Identification: Identifies the most carbon-intensive areas within the company's value chain, highlighting specific activities, suppliers, or processes contributing the most to the overall footprint. This feature provides actionable insights for targeted reduction efforts.

Predictive Emission Modeling: Employs machine learning models to forecast future emissions based on historical data and projected business growth. This enables proactive planning and scenario analysis for emission reduction targets.

ESG Reporting & Compliance: Generates standardized ESG reports compliant with frameworks like GRI, SASB, and TCFD. Provides customizable dashboards and visualizations for easy communication of sustainability performance to stakeholders.

Supply Chain Emissions Tracking: Integrates with supplier databases and uses AI to estimate emissions associated with different suppliers, enabling companies to engage suppliers in reduction efforts and track progress.
user_journeys: A sustainability manager logs into the platform, uploads the company's financial transactions and operational data, selects the relevant industry sector. The AI algorithms automatically calculate the carbon footprint, identify emission hotspots in the supply chain, and generate a detailed report for ESG compliance, highlighting areas for immediate reduction and allowing the manager to set reduction targets for the next quarter.
ai_capabilities: Machine Learning for Emission Estimation: Uses regression models (e.g., Random Forest, XGBoost) trained on industry-specific emissions factors to estimate Scope 3 emissions based on financial transactions and supplier data. Considers features like transaction amount, supplier location, industry sector, and product category.

NLP for Data Extraction: Employs NLP techniques to extract relevant information from unstructured data sources like invoices and supplier contracts, automatically populating data fields for emission calculations.

Predictive Modeling for Forecasting: Utilizes time series analysis and machine learning models to forecast future emissions based on historical data, projected business growth, and planned reduction initiatives.
Clustering for Hotspot Identification: Applies clustering algorithms to identify groups of activities or suppliers with similar emission profiles, enabling targeted reduction efforts.

input_data_types: Financial transactions (e.g., bank statements, expense reports)
Operational data (e.g., energy consumption, transportation logs)
Supplier data (e.g., supplier list, product categories, location)
Industry benchmarks (e.g., emissions per revenue, per employee)
data_schema_recommendations: Transactions Table: transaction_id (UUID), date (DATE), description (TEXT), amount (DECIMAL), currency (TEXT), category (TEXT), supplier (TEXT)
Operational Data Table: record_id (UUID), date (DATE), data_type (TEXT), value (DECIMAL), unit (TEXT)
Supplier Table: supplier_id (UUID), name (TEXT), location (TEXT), industry (TEXT), emissions_factor (DECIMAL)
data_sources: Third-party emissions factor databases (e.g., IPCC, DEFRA)
External APIs for currency conversion and location data
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: GDPR, CCPA compliance for handling personal data related to employees and suppliers. SOC 2 compliance for data security. Compliance with industry-specific regulations such as the EU Emissions Trading System (EU ETS).

required_integrations: Salesforce, HubSpot (CRM systems for customer-related emissions)
Internal ERP systems for operational data
Email providers (e.g., SendGrid, Mailgun) for automated reporting
Analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) for user behavior tracking
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for API authentication. OAuth 2.0 for integration with third-party services. Clerk/Auth0 recommendations for user authentication and authorization.

technical_specifications.architecture: A multi-tier architecture consisting of a frontend application, a backend API layer, a database for storing data, and an AI pipeline for processing and analyzing data. The frontend provides a user interface for data input, visualization, and reporting. The backend API layer handles user authentication, data validation, and communication with the database and AI pipeline. The database stores user data, emissions factors, and calculation results. The AI pipeline performs data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, and emission estimation.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes (JSONB column for storing dynamic data)
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob (for storing reports and uploaded documents)
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API (GPT-4 for data extraction from unstructured documents), embeddings, vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors) for semantic search of emission factors
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST API for communication between frontend and backend
recommended_tech_stack.CI_CD: GitHub â†’ Vercel automatic deploy pipeline

API_design: POST /api/v1/footprint: Calculates the carbon footprint based on the provided data. Payload: { transactions: [], operational_data: [], supplier_data: [] }. Response: { scope1: DECIMAL, scope2: DECIMAL, scope3: DECIMAL, hotspots: [] }
GET /api/v1/report: Generates an ESG report based on the calculated footprint. Parameters: report_format (PDF, CSV), compliance_standard (GRI, SASB). Response: File download URL
GET /api/v1/suppliers: Retrieves a list of suppliers and their estimated emissions. Parameters: page, page_size. Response: { suppliers: [], total_count: INTEGER }
frontend_components: Data Input Form: A form for users to upload financial transactions, operational data, and supplier information. Utilizes drag-and-drop functionality and data validation.
Dashboard: A customizable dashboard displaying key carbon footprint metrics, emission hotspots, and progress towards reduction targets.
Report Generator: A tool for generating ESG reports in various formats and compliance standards.
Supplier Management: A module for managing supplier data and tracking supplier emissions.

deployment_instructions: Directory Structure: /frontend (Next.js app), /backend (Node.js serverless functions), /database (SQL schema definitions), /ai (ML model code)
Environment Variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DATABASE_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, SENDGRID_API_KEY, ANALYTICS_API_KEY
Vercel Deployment: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure environment variables. Enable automatic deployments on push to main branch.
Build Outputs: Next.js static export for frontend, Node.js serverless functions for backend.
Runtime Settings: Node.js runtime for backend, Vercel serverless functions for API endpoints.

pricing_strategy: SaaS Subscription Tiers: Free (limited features, small companies), Basic (core features, mid-sized companies), Premium (full features, enterprise companies)
Usage-Based Pricing: Additional fees for processing large volumes of data or generating customized reports.
Add-ons: Consulting services for emission reduction strategies and ESG reporting.
customer_segments: Small Businesses: Need simple and affordable carbon accounting solutions.
Mid-Market Companies: Require more comprehensive features and reporting capabilities.
Enterprises: Demand advanced analytics, customization, and integration with existing systems.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: Number of active users, data upload volume, report generation frequency, API call volume.
AI Performance KPIs: Accuracy of emission estimation (measured by comparing with verified data), data gap fill rate, model training time.
Adoption/Engagement KPIs: User engagement (time spent on platform, features used), customer retention rate, customer satisfaction (measured by surveys and feedback).
